clinical_study.brief_title: Health and QoL in Oncological Patients: Management of Bone Pathology in Italian Citbl Population
clinical_study.official_title: Health and Quality of Life in Oncological Patients: Management of Bone Pathology in the Italian Citbl (Cancer Treatment Induced Bone Loss) Population

lead_sponsor.agency: Fondazione Policlinico Universitario Agostino Gemelli IRCCS

clinical_study.source: Fondazione Policlinico Universitario Agostino Gemelli IRCCS

brief_summary.textblock: Studying the current state of the clinical approaches to bone diseases in breast cancer patients treated with adjuvant and/or hormone therapy

primary_outcome.measure: Results from some questionnaires related to patients QoL, rated from 1 to 10.
primary_outcome.description: Description of the current state of the most frequent clinical and therapeutical approaches to bone diseases in 700 breast cancer menopausal patients treated with adjuvant and/or hormonal therapy. These patients are assessed by questionnaires regarding quality of life, menopausal status and current anti resorptive treatments

arm_group.arm_group_label: Fondazione Policlinico Universitario A. Gemelli, Roma
arm_group.description: Polo Scienze della Salute della Donna e del Bambino

arm_group.arm_group_label: Fondazione Policlinico Universitario A. Gemelli Roma
Istituto Nazionale dei Tumori di Napoli Fondazione G.Pascale

intervention.description: Studying the current state of the clinical approaches to bone diseases in breast cancer patients treated with adjuvant and/or hormone therapy
intervention.arm_group_label: Fondazione Policlinico Universitario A. Gemelli Roma
Fondazione Policlinico Universitario A. Gemelli, Roma
Istituto Nazionale dei Tumori di Napoli Fondazione G.Pascale

study_pop.textblock: Women affected by breast cancer in menopause or with secondary amenorrhea arising from the initiation of oncologic treatments

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients willing to provide the Informed consent to participate to the study
- Women aged 18-75 years
- Patients having breast cancer, with no phenotype restrictions
- Patients in natural and stable menopause
- Patients having secondary amenorrhea, that arose after the initiation of oncologic treatment, since at least 12 months or 6 months with FSH> 40 U/I
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with advanced cancer and/or bone metastases and/or visceral metastases
- Patients with severe renal insufficiency and/or in dialysis and patients affected by severe endocrine disorders

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Fondazione Policlinico Universitario Agostino Gemelli IRCCS
